alert.note: Alert for Osceola (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 1:23PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Osceola County through 200 PM EDT... At 123 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Osceola Heritage Park, or near Saint Cloud, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Kissimmee, Saint Cloud, West Lake Toho, Intercession City and Buena Ventura Lakes. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!
